comment.author: 11572312@N00
comment._content: French dramatist Pierre Corneille was born in Rouen in 1606. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pierre_Corneille From another site: French dramatist and poet, born at Rouen, in the Rue de la Pie, on the 6th of June 1606. The house, which was long preserved, was destroyed in the 19th century. www.nndb.com/people/159/000025084/ And from the NYTimes: query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9A07E2D91531E733A...

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Decided to track down visual confirmation, given the conflicting references to his house being destroyed in 1800s vs. a house confirmed as Corneille's in 1906. The Bain photo matches this view of a museum in France, founded in 1879. See (1) www.corneille.org/articles.php?lng=fr&pg=69 and (2) www.sibmas.org/idpac/europe/frp006.html Visiblanda: Thanks for the museum's location!

comment.author: 33365539@N00
comment._content: The father of Corneille bought the House in 1608. The place is not Rouen, but Petit Couronne,10 Km of Rouen. It was intended as second residence. The main House was at Rouen, but no longer exists. www.seinemaritime.net/musees_detail_departement_seine-mar...
